## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1 (P1)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 322, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 539, 910, 570]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 910, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 600, 598, 615]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 615, 608, 630]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 644, 608, 660]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 660, 757, 675]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 675, 440, 690]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 917, 102]]<|/det|>
The coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 + \frac{x}{2}\right)^{6} + (a + x)^{5}\) is 330. Find the value of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 98, 920, 117]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 910, 92]]<|/det|>
The function f is such that \(\operatorname {f}(x) = a + b\cos x\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 2\pi\). It is given that \(\operatorname {f}\bigl (\frac{1}{3}\pi \bigr) = 5\) and \(\operatorname {f}(\pi) = 11\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 104, 156, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 104, 482, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the values of the constants \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 510, 747, 528]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(k\) for which the equation \(\operatorname {f}(x) = k\) has no solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[299, 81, 732, 300]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 320, 920, 392]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a three-dimensional shape. The base \(OAB\) is a horizontal triangle in which angle \(AOB\) is \(90^{\circ}\). The side \(OBCD\) is a rectangle and the side \(OAD\) lies in a vertical plane. Unit vectors \(\mathbf{i}\) and \(\mathbf{j}\) are parallel to \(OA\) and \(OB\) respectively and the unit vector \(\mathbf{k}\) is vertical. The position vectors of \(A\), \(B\) and \(D\) are given by \(\overrightarrow{OA} = 8\mathbf{i}\), \(\overrightarrow{OB} = 5\mathbf{j}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OD} = 2\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 408, 156, 427]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 405, 648, 427]]<|/det|>
Express each of the vectors \(\overrightarrow{DA}\) and \(\overrightarrow{CA}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{i}\), \(\mathbf{j}\) and \(\mathbf{k}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 408, 920, 427]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 479, 92]]<|/det|>
Use a scalar product to find angle \(CAD\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 82, 683, 242]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 261, 920, 312]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows points \(A\) and \(B\) on a circle with centre \(O\) and radius \(r\). The tangents to the circle at \(A\) and \(B\) meet at \(T\). The shaded region is bounded by the minor arc \(AB\) and the lines \(AT\) and \(BT\). Angle \(AOB\) is \(2\theta\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 324, 156, 343]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 324, 920, 357]]<|/det|>
In the case where the area of the sector \(AOB\) is the same as the area of the shaded region, show that \(\tan \theta = 2\theta\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[851, 339, 920, 358]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
In the case where \(r = 8 \mathrm{cm}\) and the length of the minor arc \(AB\) is \(19.2 \mathrm{cm}\), find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 593, 92]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by f : \(x\mapsto 7 - 2x^{2} - 12x\) for \(x\in \mathbb{R}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 104, 156, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 104, 771, 123]]<|/det|>
Express \(7 - 2x^{2} - 12x\) in the form \(a - 2(x + b)^{2}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 740, 186, 758]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 740, 680, 758]]<|/det|>
State the coordinates of the stationary point on the curve \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 739, 920, 758]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Points \(A\) and \(B\) have coordinates \((h, h)\) and \((4h + 6, 5h)\) respectively. The equation of the perpendicular bisector of \(AB\) is \(3x + 2y = k\). Find the values of the constants \(h\) and \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A point \(P\) moves along the curve in such a way that the \(y\)-coordinate is increasing at a constant rate of 0.06 units per second. Find the rate of change of the \(x\)-coordinate when \(P\) passes through (2, 5).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 515, 185, 534]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 512, 416, 551]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} \times \frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) is constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 520, 920, 539]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 73, 618, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(2\cos x + 3\sin x = 0\), for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 73, 870, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on the same diagram, the graphs of \(y = 2\cos x\) and \(y = - 3\sin x\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 360^{\circ}\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 528, 153, 547]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 528, 920, 562]]<|/det|>
Use your answers to parts (i) and (ii) to find the set of values of \(x\) for \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 360^{\circ}\) for which \(2\cos x + 3\sin x > 0. \)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 543, 920, 562]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Find, showing all necessary working, the volume obtained when the shaded region is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis. Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[484, 46, 512, 63]]<|/det|>
